title: So Tired of Teams "piling it on" one person
body: I just played a game yesterday, and our ADC a trist was doing poorly. while everyone can have a bad game that is not the problem, the problem I have is when the team starts constantly berating this 1 person. whenever the person dies the ? ping, all chat saying what is this trist doing. I don't understand this as I am sure everyone has been on that side where people are reacting so harshly to every mistake you make big or small, and it just makes you play more poorly and kills your drive to win. I see games like this all the time and it really needs to stop we should all know better.

replies.body:
I just wish there was a 'mute all' button on scoreboard and a 'mute everything' button on each person.

You can mute emotes, pings, and chat on each person, but it'd be nice to have options for just doing it with everyone.
just wish people treated other people like "people".

> just wish people treated other people like "people".

That would be the ideal, but since the inception of the internet, people have been dicks over the internet.  It's very much the status quo of how humans treat 'others'.  Without seeing that person, our basal instincts is to put that individual in the 'other' camp.  At least that's my view of why people are so default mean on the interwebs.

There is.

/fullmute all

Unfortunately this does NOT mute TEAM emotes.
enemy emotes can be muted in game settings.
It also leaves 'certain' passive teammate responses unmuted (not chat or regular pings).
Well, when a single person is losing the game for 4 other people, what do you expect?

> it just makes you play more poorly and kills your drive to win. 

Not really,its on you if you play poorly just because some online strangers are annoying you. If what you said was true then Korea wouldn't be the most competitive region. Just mute and play for Christ sake.

This is like a boss sitting over your shoulder and criticizing every keystroke you make. This is not a good environment for anyone and the fact of the matter is people should not behave this way at all.

I had a top lane Teemo feed an Irelia so hard she was able to legit 1v5. If you're a feeder in a ranked game, you deserve getting shat on by your team. Don't come into people's ranked games and die 7 times in lane. In my opinion you deserve all the flame you get when you do that, myself included.

It's just immature people who don't know any better. What's the point of lashing out against this person. Your assholery won't turn them into good players. I swear men are getting bitchier and bitchier every year. Need some good ol' fashioned fellas who know when to STFU.
Starts as one and then the whole team is just on it. I literally said stop and just told trist just do what you can I know you are trying.

Weird pick here.

Getting scapegoated **EVERY TIME**(with very few exceptions) I am in a lost game, even when I am not having a bad game. Basically, the ones having a bad game are flaming me. 

I handle it without raging back, muting or going on tilt(= playing worse), _most of the time. _

It might seem like a weird message from me, but it would be nice to grow a pair if you play a stressfully competitive game. 

No matter what punishments there are, no matter how hunanized you are, no matter how inappropriate it feels to you - someone **will** notice your mistakes, someone **will** get stressed and someone **will** shout at you.

Ugh. Try being a jungler. I played 6 games with a friend and 5/6 of those games, I got flamed. I even got flamed with a 7/6/9 kda as a tank where I got 5 drags, 1 rift, and 1 baron. We had 22 kills on our team (so that's a 68% kill participation) and 24 deaths on our team (25% death participation). Like, I don't even know what I could have done different. Typically I just ignore team mates, but I was literally like everywhere.
People will always blame someone. But most times, it's the jungler. If I wasn't so good at jungling, I'd go to another lane, but that's my best role. Meh.
